docs.title: How do we live? What do we eat? What do we do?
docs.text:
Welcome to S4H X! Our Scrum Team works on maintaining 16 components for localization in Brazil. However, we also occasionally deal with issues related to Argentina, Peru, Mexico, Venezuela, and Chile. Additionally, we handle legal changes related to Brazil. When there are no legal changes to address, all developers on the team work on customer cases that come to us through Service Now.

Thus, in addition to keeping the S/4 HANA Cloud and On-Premise products updated in accordance with Brazilian laws, the team's goal is to assist customers with any potential issues that may arise in the system. We work optimally for the satisfaction and success of our customers.

docs.title: SAP Note
docs.text:
What is a SAP Note?

A SAP Note é um documento que serve para entregar a correção que você realizou para o cliente. Nela estarão todas as informações da correção que você realizou, versões e possíveis anexos necessários.

Após o clinte identificar que a SAP Note se encaixa para solucionar a questão que ele deseja, ele pode implementá-la em seu sistema (através da transação SNOTE) fazendo com que a solução chegue até o sistema dele.

o que não é uma SAP Note?

In the situation where no changes are done in the code, an SAP Note cannot describe the way to work around an issue. For such a situation, the SAP Note must be replaced by a SAP KBA (KBA stands for Knowledge Base Article).

The KBA are mainly created by Product Support organization.

docs.title: Deep analysis
docs.text:
At this stage, it is necessary to conduct a thorough analysis based on the points mentioned in the case. Some actions that can be taken in this stage are:

  • look for documentation that supports understanding of the issue;
  • analyze the scenario in the client's system;
  • reproduce the scenario mentioned by the client internally;
  • validate if the mentioned issue is really a problem.

After verifying these points and conducting a thorough analysis, you can make a decision on how to proceed with this case.

Tip

If you find yourself stuck in the analysis, it is important to seek help from the team's channel (log-sle-lcm-brx). Additionally, we have the daily meeting, which is also a great time to ask for assistance.

Thus, at the end of this initial analysis, you can take one of two paths: consulting or correction.

docs.text:
Customer Effort is an indicator of customer satisfaction with the case. This indicator is obtained through a survey that the customer optionally responds to at the end of the case processing.

Abstract

The survey question that serves as the parameter for the indicator gives the customer the option to rate with a score from 1 to 5.

Our goal is for 85% of the surveys responded to have scores of 4 and 5.

Thus, we take various precautions when processing an incident to ensure our evaluation is as positive as possible. These precautions are:

docs.title: Communication With the Customer
docs.text:
All communication messages sent to the client in cases must be clear, periodic, empathetic, and humanized. To achieve this, we have some rules:

  • Provide updates on client cases at intervals of no more than 3 days.
  • All messages sent to the client must be reviewed by the Scrum Master (Filipe Mello) and Product Owner (Guilherme Oliveira).

Tip

To obtain message reviews more easily, we suggest creating a group on Slack that includes the Scrum Master and Product Owner of the team to send the messages when necessary.

The survey responses are actively monitored and provide valuable input allowing us to better support our customers.

We appreciate your time.

docs.text: When you leave the team, the ideal is that all the cases you have picked up, or processes in which you were involved, are finalized. However, if you end up leaving some case behind, it is important to make a handover so that we can pass on these cases/processes in the best way to the next people who join the team.

docs.text:
The Handover must be done through the outlook, an email must be sent to the Product Owner of the team (Guilherme de Oliveira), to the person who manages the incident queue (Amanda de Oliveira) and to the Scrum Master (Filipe de Mello).

Note

This email should contain a status with what has already been seen (analytics) regarding your cases in progress, waiting confirmation and resolved but not returned by the customer.

It is important that the handover is very complete and didactic, so that the person who is going to continue working on the incidents has a good sense of their progress.

Below are some examples of Handover:

docs.title: Division of Tasks
docs.text:
The team's tasks are divided into two parts: cases and legal changes. Therefore, different people will work on each type of task.

Below is an explanation of how these tasks are received and how they work:

docs.title: Receiving Cases
docs.text:
When you join the team, if you’re not going to work on legal changes (remembering that when we don’t have any legal changes to act, everyone works with cases), you’ll be queued to receive incidents.

First, it’s important that you verify that you have access to the service now to be able to respond to incidents. If you do not have, click here to access the topic that will help you set up the system.

Incidents are distributed according to the queue and not according to the specific knowledge of each person. This is done so that everyone can learn new things and develop into different components

Incidents will be attributed to you and, as soon as this happens, you will receive a message in the slack of the person queue manager, right now is Amanda de Oliveira. In this message, you will be informed which case you received and will have their access link in the service now.

Example of a message you’ll get through the slack of the team’s Queue Manager person:

A (priority) case of (component) has arrived, and I'm directing it to you:

NAME -> (Case Title)

PRODUCT -> (On Premise or Cloud)

CUSTOMER -> (Customer Name)

LINK -> (Service Now case link)

MPT -> (MTP information: X days left or X days expired)

OBS.: (Case-relevant remarks)

As soon as you get a case, you can already start acting on it.

Note

All status updates that occur in the case will be automatically modified on the Jira Board (platform we use during the daily to go through the incidents), there is no need to update anything on the board.

Avoid

If possible, do not direct any cases assigned to you to another colleague without talking to the queue manager person. Ideally, each person in the team should remain with the cases assigned to them.

Tip

When it comes to prioritizing cases (if you have more than one to perform the treatment), it is important to prioritize the cases with higher priority (Very High -> High -> Medium -> Low).

Moreover, focused on the product, the treatment order is:

  1. Cases Cloud

  2. Cases On Premise

However, when On Premise is related to OIL, we must act quickly.

If you are in doubt about the priority of your cases, contact the Product Owner or Scrum Master of the team.

docs.title: Legal Changes
docs.text:
We work on legal changes for Brazil as they are released by the government. When new legal changes need to be implemented in S4H X, the Product Owner provides the necessary information during the planning meeting so that we can organize the backlog with the tasks required to make the system modifications. Additionally, this meeting allows us to stay informed about the delivery dates for the modification.

During the planning meeting, colleagues will also be assigned to work on the created backlog. These colleagues will focus exclusively on the legal change and will not work in customer cases.

How does this meeting work?

The Daily (a tool of the agile methodology used by the team: Scrum) is basically a daily meeting that lasts around 30 minutes.

The discussion in this meeting aims to understand what was accomplished the previous day, what needs to be done on the current day, and also to identify any bottlenecks that are hindering the progress of the processes.

In addition to aligning the points of the Sprint, the Daily is important because it keeps communication constant within the team. In other words, it keeps everyone aware of the progress and completion of the work stages.

Team Specifics

Since we don’t always have legal changes to act, our daily works through the hands raised at the time of the teams meeting (app option). In this way, we go through each person and, thus, each one can talk about what is currently working, be it cases or legal changes. See below for an example:

How does this meeting work?

In this meeting, we talk with our Product Support team about possible cases where they may have doubts or are stuck.

We usually discuss this meeting in advance on the Slack channel mm-dev-ps-support. In this channel, the cases to be addressed in the meeting are sent beforehand, or if the Product Support colleagues don't have any cases to bring to the meeting, they will notify us there of the request to cancel the meeting for that specific week (done by the team's Scrum Master).

• Day of the week: Monday
  • Meeting Time: 4 p.m.

Retrospective is one of the meetings in the agile methodology used by the team: Scrum.

In the situation where no changes are done in the code, an SAP Note cannot describe the way to work around an issue. For such a situation, the SAP Note must be replaced by a SAP KBA (KBA stands for Knowledge Base Article).

The team's tasks are divided into two parts: cases and legal changes. Therefore, different people will work on each type of task.

Below is an explanation of how these tasks are received and how they work:

docs.title: Receiving Cases
docs.text:
When you join the team, if you’re not going to work on legal changes (remembering that when we don’t have any legal changes to act, everyone works with cases), you’ll be queued to receive incidents.

First, it’s important that you verify that you have access to the service now to be able to respond to incidents. If you do not have, click here to access the topic that will help you set up the system.

Incidents are distributed according to the queue and not according to the specific knowledge of each person. This is done so that everyone can learn new things and develop into different components

Incidents will be attributed to you and, as soon as this happens, you will receive a message in the slack of the person queue manager, right now is Amanda de Oliveira. In this message, you will be informed which case you received and will have their access link in the service now.

Example of a message you’ll get through the slack of the team’s Queue Manager person:

A (priority) case of (component) has arrived, and I'm directing it to you:

NAME -> (Case Title)

PRODUCT -> (On Premise or Cloud)

CUSTOMER -> (Customer Name)

LINK -> (Service Now case link)

MPT -> (MTP information: X days left or X days expired)

OBS.: (Case-relevant remarks)

As soon as you get a case, you can already start acting on it.

Note

All status updates that occur in the case will be automatically modified on the Jira Board (platform we use during the daily to go through the incidents), there is no need to update anything on the board.

Avoid

If possible, do not direct any cases assigned to you to another colleague without talking to the queue manager person. Ideally, each person in the team should remain with the cases assigned to them.

Tip

When it comes to prioritizing cases (if you have more than one to perform the treatment), it is important to prioritize the cases with higher priority (Very High -> High -> Medium -> Low).

Moreover, focused on the product, the treatment order is:

  1. Cases Cloud

  2. Cases On Premise

However, when On Premise is related to OIL, we must act quickly.

If you are in doubt about the priority of your cases, contact the Product Owner or Scrum Master of the team.

docs.title: Legal Changes
docs.text:
We work on legal changes for Brazil as they are released by the government. When new legal changes need to be implemented in S4H X, the Product Owner provides the necessary information during the planning meeting so that we can organize the backlog with the tasks required to make the system modifications. Additionally, this meeting allows us to stay informed about the delivery dates for the modification.

During the planning meeting, colleagues will also be assigned to work on the created backlog. These colleagues will focus exclusively on the legal change and will not work in customer cases.

docs.text:
• Meeting Time: 10 a.m.

How does this meeting work?

The Daily (a tool of the agile methodology used by the team: Scrum) is basically a daily meeting that lasts around 30 minutes.

The discussion in this meeting aims to understand what was accomplished the previous day, what needs to be done on the current day, and also to identify any bottlenecks that are hindering the progress of the processes.

In addition to aligning the points of the Sprint, the Daily is important because it keeps communication constant within the team. In other words, it keeps everyone aware of the progress and completion of the work stages.

Team Specifics

Since we don’t always have legal changes to act, our daily works through the hands raised at the time of the teams meeting (app option). In this way, we go through each person and, thus, each one can talk about what is currently working, be it cases or legal changes. See below for an example:

How does this meeting work?

In this meeting, we talk with our Product Support team about possible cases where they may have doubts or are stuck.

We usually discuss this meeting in advance on the Slack channel mm-dev-ps-support. In this channel, the cases to be addressed in the meeting are sent beforehand, or if the Product Support colleagues don't have any cases to bring to the meeting, they will notify us there of the request to cancel the meeting for that specific week (done by the team's Scrum Master).

docs.title: Analysis of cases with the architects of the area
docs.text:
• Day of the week: Monday
  • Meeting Time: 4 p.m.

How does this meeting work?

In this meeting, we discuss with the architects from our area the cases that our team is currently handling, which are either blocked or need more technical assistance.

On Friday, before the meeting, we discuss in the daily stand-up possible cases that we can bring for discussion. The individuals assigned to the selected cases should prepare a summary and send it to the team’s Scrum Master on Friday. The Scrum Master will then post the case summaries in the Slack group with the architects (s4h-x-and-log-architects) so they can review the scenarios in advance, making the meeting more productive."

docs.text:
• Day of the week: usually thursday
  • Meeting Time: usually at 1:30 p.m.

How does this meeting work?

Planning is one of the meetings in the agile methodology used by the team: Scrum.

In our planning, we usually discuss legal changes for Brazil and plan the modifications we need to make in the system regarding them. The Product Owner brings the information about the development that the team will need to carry out, and then the Scrum Master leads the team in creating the development backlog.

During this meeting, delivery deadlines are detailed, and the team's main questions are addressed. Additionally, the individuals who will work on the development of the legal change are assigned.

docs.title: Retrospective
docs.text:
• Day of the week: usually wednesday
  • Meeting Time: usually in the late afternoon

How does this meeting work?

Retrospective is one of the meetings in the agile methodology used by the team: Scrum.

This meeting is a time for us to analyze how our sprint went. The goal is to discuss what worked well and what didn't, and based on this conversation, we will create possible actions for the team to improve in the mentioned aspects.

It is extremely important that everyone on the team participates in this meeting and is sincere and honest about their thoughts on the sprint. This will help the team evolve and improve the necessary aspects.

docs.title: Code Review
docs.text:
• Day of the week: choice of the responsible developer
  • Meeting Time: choice of the responsible developer

How does this meeting work?

Whenever we make corrections in the systems, whether through cases or legal changes, we must hold a Code Review meeting.

The meeting should be scheduled via email and sent to the team DL

DL GLO LOG S4H X - LCM - External (External)

In this meeting, the developer responsible for the solution should present the modification made and the unit tests (if required for the correction).

At the end of the meeting, minutes should be filled out. The minutes should include the actions identified for the solution during the meeting. Responsible individuals should be assigned to these actions, and then the minutes should be sent via email.

This meeting helps us ensure that there are no potential failures or regression scenarios in the team's developments. By maintaining this active practice, we can be more accurate with what we deliver to our clients.
